private_information: I can manipulate vowel-labeled blocks only: A, E, I.
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help reconfigure the stacks to reach the global target ordering where A is on B, B on C, ..., L on M, and M on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate consonant-labeled blocks only: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help reconfigure the stacks to reach the global target ordering where A is on B, B on C, ..., L on M, and M on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move fragments and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that achieves the final stacked ordering: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, with M on the table.

public_information: Blocks present: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M.
Accessibility rule: agents can only pick up blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
Only one block can be moved at a time by any agent.
Vowel agent may only manipulate vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I).
Consonant agent may only manipulate consonant-labeled blocks (all non-vowels).
Initial configuration: C is on the table.
Initial configuration: L is on the table.
Initial configuration: K is on top of L.
Initial configuration: F is on top of K.
Initial configuration: B is on top of C.
Initial configuration: D is on top of F.
Initial configuration: M is on top of D.
Initial configuration: E is on top of M.
Initial configuration: A is on top of E.
Initial configuration: G is on top of B.
Initial configuration: I is on top of G.
Initial configuration: J is on top of I.
Initial configuration: H is on top of A.
Goal configuration: A is on top of B.
Goal configuration: B is on top of C.
Goal configuration: C is on top of D.
Goal configuration: D is on top of E.
Goal configuration: E is on top of F.
Goal configuration: F is on top of G.
Goal configuration: G is on top of H.
Goal configuration: H is on top of I.
Goal configuration: I is on top of J.
Goal configuration: J is on top of K.
Goal configuration: K is on top of L.
Goal configuration: L is on top of M.
Goal configuration: M is on the table.

plan.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that proposes concrete move sequences for vowel blocks. Use a simple action language where each step is formatted as: move <BLOCK> from <SOURCE> to <TARGET>. Only propose moves that manipulate vowels A, E, I and only moves that pick top blocks. Do not produce PDDL. If you need to state assumptions about accessibility or intermediate temporary placements, list them clearly.
plan.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Use the public information about blocks and initial state provided by the environment and your private information about which blocks you can move. Provide an ordered sequence of allowed moves that involves only vowel blocks and that contributes toward the global goal. Also list any assumptions or unresolved dependencies that would require consonant_agent moves. Output your result as a concise plan and an assumptions list.

plan.system_prompt: You are a specialist agent that proposes concrete move sequences for consonant blocks. Use a simple action language where each step is formatted as: move <BLOCK> from <SOURCE> to <TARGET>. Only propose moves that manipulate consonant blocks and only moves that pick top blocks. Do not produce PDDL. If you need to state assumptions about accessibility or intermediate temporary placements, list them clearly.
plan.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Use the public information about blocks and initial state provided by the environment and your private information about which blocks you can move. Provide an ordered sequence of allowed moves that involves only consonant blocks and that contributes toward the global goal. Also list any assumptions or unresolved dependencies that would require vowel_agent moves. Output your result as a concise plan and an assumptions list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and you must produce a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the move fragments and assumptions supplied by the two agents, resolve naming inconsistencies, and ensure actions remain distinct per agent if needed. Produce a STRIPS-compatible domain and a problem file that encodes the initial and goal stack configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility: use a single domain file and a problem file, avoid extensions not supported by FastDownwards, and prefer standard STRIPS action descriptions.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive two plan fragments and assumptions from the agents. Use the public environment information and the agents' plan fragments {plan_vowel} and {plan_consonant}. Reconcile any conflicts and fill missing details so the resulting PDDL domain and problem achieve the global goal: A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, and M on the table. Keep agent actions logically separable if relevant but produce a single coherent domain and problem for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
